The IMSAFE checklist helps pilots and co-pilots determine if they are fit to fly. It is critically important that every pilot conduct a personal pre-flight health assessment before piloting any aircraft. There are myriad physiological and psychological factors that could impair a pilotâ€™s ability and render a flight unsafe. The IMSAFE checklist ensures pilots meet the standards in Title 14 Code of Federal Regulations (14 CFR) part 67 before any flight. IMSAFE stands for:
  1. Illness: Do you have current or recent illnesses that could affect flight?
  2. Medication: Have you been taking any meds that could impair your ability to fly?
  3. Stress: Are you experiencing unusual psychological pressure and/or anxiety?
  4. Alcohol: Have you had any alcohol in the last eight hours? Are you hungover?
  5. Fatigue: Are you tired and/or not adequately rested?
  6. Emotion: Are you emotionally upset about anything?
